definitions.definition: A type of gas turbine aircraft engine that drives and obtains essentially all thrust from an external (typically unducted) propeller.
An aircraft that uses a turboprop engine.
Wearing or grinding down by friction.
The gradual reduction in a tangible or intangible resource due to causes that are passive and do not involve productive use of the resource.
(human resources) A gradual, natural reduction in membership or personnel, as through retirement, resignation, or death.
The loss of participants during an experiment.
Imperfect contrition or remorse.
The wearing of teeth due to their grinding.
The loss of a first or second language or a portion of that language.
To grind or wear down through friction.
definitions.example: attritioned teeth; attritioned rock

definitions.definition: To reduce the number of (jobs or workers) by not hiring new employees to fill positions that become vacant (often with out).
definitions.example: As a result of the new policy, people were being attritioned out.

definitions.definition: To undergo a reduction in number.
definitions.example: The cohort of one hundred students had attritioned to sixty by the end of secondary school.

definitions.definition: Relation or connection by blood, marriage or adoption
Relation or connection by nature or character
A video game of the genre characterized by jumping (or otherwise moving) to and from suspended platforms or over obstacles.

Either of two large ground-dwelling Australian songbirds, of the genus Menura, named because of the beautiful tail feathers of the male of one species, the superb lyrebird (Menura novaehollandiae), which can be erected to look like a lyre, and notable for their extraordinary ability to mimic natural and artificial sounds from their environment.
A player who handles the ball skilfully
(chiefly in Chicago) A person who specializes in catching home-run and foul balls.
Any of various long-legged wading birds in the family Threskiornithidae, having long downcurved bills used to probe the mud for prey such as crustaceans.
Not remotely possible.
Unlawful killing of a human being without malice aforethought, either express or implied, with the absence of intention.
A period of three months or about three months; quarter.
definitions.example: She is in the second trimester of her first pregnancy.

definitions.definition: One of the terms of an academic year in those learning institutions that divide their teaching in three roughly equal terms, each about three months long. Compare semester.
definitions.example: The school operates on a trimester schedule.

definitions.definition: Any disorder of the muscles, tendons, joints, bones, nerves, characterized by pain, discomfort and disability.
Atrophic arthritis, rheumatoid arthritis
A prediction of future weather, often for a specific locality, in a newspaper or on the radio or television.
definitions.example: It may be sunny today, but the weather forecast is predicting rain for tomorrow.

definitions.definition: A card used in a company's loyalty program, which rewards customers who make regular purchases.
A staff or truncheon, used for various purposes
definitions.example: the baton of a field marshal

definitions.definition: The stick of a conductor in musical performances.
An object transferred by runners in a relay race.
A short stout club used primarily by policemen; a truncheon (UK).
An abatement in coats of arms to denote illegitimacy. (Also spelled batune, baston).
A riband with the ends cut off, resembling a baton, as shown on a coat of arms.
A short vertical lightweight post, not set into the ground, used to separate wires in a fence.
To strike with a baton.
Of or relating to the Bible.
definitions.example: Tithing is both a quranic and biblical virtue.

definitions.definition: In accordance with the teachings of the Bible (according to some interpretation of it).
definitions.example: The biblical teaching is that [...]

definitions.definition: Very great; especially, exceeding previous records in scale.
definitions.example: of biblical proportions; with biblical fury

definitions.definition: The act of bewitching, or enchanting
The state or condition of being fascinated.
definitions.example: To my fascination, the skies turned all kinds of colours.

definitions.definition: Something which fascinates.
definitions.example: Life after death had always been a great fascination to him.

definitions.definition: (usually derogatory) An enforcement institution designed to protect an autocratic government via strict and repressive control of the people.
A person who is expecting to give birth.
A dietary supplement to be taken by somebody expecting to give birth.
definitions.example: She was recommended a course of zinc prenatals.

definitions.definition: Being or happening before birth.
Inflammation of the tonsils.
In a television studio, theatre or concert hall, the room where performers await their entrance.
The inside of a tube (i.e. of a wave making a tube).
Any of the birds, such as ducks, geese and swans, that spend most of their non-flying time on water; especially those of the family Anatidae.
A place where anything is kept in store
A large natural or artificial lake used as a source of water supply.
A small intercellular space, often containing resin, essential oil, or some other secreted matter.
A supply or source of something.
A species that acts as host to a zoonosis when it is not causing acute illness in other susceptible species.
Gram (unit of mass)
A tree of the Acer genus, characterised by its usually palmate leaves and winged seeds.
The wood of such a tree, prized for its hardness and attractive appearance
Excessively protective, wanting to give too much protection (especially to children)
Anything that amplifies, or makes something larger or more intense.
An adverb that adds intensity, such as "really" or "totally".
An appliance or circuit that increases the strength of a weak electrical signal without changing the other characteristics of the signal.
A portable encasement that houses a large speaker, used to amplify voices and musical instruments at live performances.
A lens that enlarges the field of vision.
A genre of rock music, normally published on independent labels, comprising many subgenres, most distinguished by the prevalence of thick and distorted guitar music.
In a right triangle, the ratio of the length of the side opposite an angle to the length of the hypotenuse.
The period of duration from the first date of one month to the last date of the same month, which can thus vary from 28 to 31 days in length.
A graduated, circular scale over which a needle moves to show a measurement (such as speed).
A clock face.
A sundial.
A panel on a radio etc showing wavelengths or channels; a knob that is turned to change the wavelength etc.
A disk with finger holes on a telephone; used to select the number to be called.
A person's face.
A miner's compass.
To control or select something with a dial, or (figuratively) as if with a dial.
definitions.example: President Trump has recently dialled down the rhetoric.

definitions.definition: To select a number, or to call someone, on a telephone.
definitions.example: In an emergency dial 999.

definitions.definition: To use a dial or a telephone.
definitions.example: Please be careful when dialling.

definitions.definition: The state or period of being a widow or widower.
A carnivorous bird that hunts for its food, especially one that preys on vertebrates.
A moving walkway; a slow conveyor belt that transports people horizontally or on an incline in a similar manner to an escalator.
Any money owed by the government of a nation.
A large criminal organization, or a group of such organizations, that deals in illegal goods and services.
definitions.example: Organized crime is largely responsible for the nation’s illicit drug trafficking.

definitions.definition: The crimes perpetrated by those organizations.
definitions.example: Organized crime has dramatically increased in our neighbourhood.

definitions.definition: A low two-wheeled cart, used in harness racing.
Any carriage seating only the driver.
Silent and withdrawn after being upset
definitions.example: the sulky child

definitions.definition: Suffering from grief, especially after a failed romance.
definitions.example: When he told me he didn't want to see me anymore, I was heartbroken.

definitions.definition: The office of a news organisation, especially that part of it where the journalists work and news stories are processed.
A room where newspapers and magazines are available for reading.
An electronic device that allows current to flow in one direction only; used chiefly as a rectifier.
Any plant whose foliage is covered with stinging, mildly poisonous hairs, causing an instant rash.
Certain plants that have spines or prickles:
Certain non-stinging plants, mostly in the family Lamiaceae, that resemble the species of Urtica:
Loosely, anything which causes a similarly stinging rash, such as a jellyfish or sea nettle.
Of the nettle plant and similar physical causes, to sting, causing a rash in someone.
definitions.example: The children were badly nettled after playing in the field.

definitions.definition: To pique, irritate, vex or provoke.
A commuter rail system that combines aspects of an interurban railway with those of a subway, using a menagerie of pathways such as viaduct, tunnel, beam, cut and cover, trench, at grade, and others.
A false or misleading picture of environmental friendliness used to conceal or obscure damaging activities.
To disseminate such information about (something).
A tabloid newspaper containing gossip and sensational news stories pertaining especially to well-known people.
To injure the dignity and self-respect of.
To make humble; to lower in condition or status.
A group of vigilantes intent on lynching someone.
Some text or a graphic in an electronic document that can be activated to display another document or trigger an action.
definitions.example: Click the hyperlink to go to the next page.

definitions.definition: (by extension) An address, URL, or program that defines a hyperlink's function.
definitions.example: Copy the hyperlink and paste it into an email.

definitions.definition: A connection between places, people, events, things, or ideas.
definitions.example: The mayor’s assistant serves as the link to the media.

definitions.definition: One element of a chain or other connected series.
definitions.example: The third link of the silver chain needs to be resoldered.

definitions.definition: The connection between buses or systems.
definitions.example: A by-N-link is composed of N lanes.

definitions.definition: A space comprising one or more disjoint knots.
A thin wild bank of land splitting two cultivated patches and often linking two hills.
An individual person or element in a system
Anything doubled and closed like a link of a chain.
definitions.example: a link of horsehair

definitions.definition: A sausage that is not a patty.

(kinematics) Any one of the several elementary pieces of a mechanism, such as the fixed frame, or a rod, wheel, mass of confined liquid, etc., by which relative motion of other parts is produced and constrained.

Any intermediate rod or piece for transmitting force or motion, especially a short connecting rod with a bearing at each end; specifically (in steam engines) the slotted bar, or connecting piece, to the opposite ends of which the eccentric rods are jointed, and by means of which the movement of the valve is varied, in a link motion.
The length of one joint of Gunter's chain, being the hundredth part of it, or 7.92 inches, the chain being 66 feet in length.
A bond of affinity, or a unit of valence between atoms; applied to a unit of chemical force or attraction.
(plural) The windings of a river; the land along a winding stream.
To connect two or more things.
(of a Web page) To contain a hyperlink to another page.
definitions.example: My homepage links to my wife's.

definitions.definition: To supply (somebody) with a hyperlink; to direct by means of a link.
definitions.example: Haven't you seen his Web site? I'll link you to it.

definitions.definition: To post a hyperlink to.
definitions.example: Stop linking those unfunny comics all the time!

definitions.definition: To demonstrate a correlation between two things.
To combine objects generated by a compiler into a single executable.
A torch, used to light dark streets.
To skip or trip along smartly; to go quickly.
A golf course, especially one situated on dunes by the sea.
A small open boat, propelled by oars or paddles, carried as a tender, lifeboat, or pleasure craft on a ship.
An inflatable rubber life raft.
To travel by dinghy.
In front of.
definitions.example: A hill loomed ahead of them.

definitions.definition: Preceding.
definitions.example: He's giving a series of concerts in London ahead of his international tour.

definitions.definition: In the future of.
definitions.example: Peter has a lot of work ahead of him.

definitions.definition: In advance of.
definitions.example: I arrived at the suite half an hour ahead of Jack.

definitions.definition: Having made more progress than.
definitions.example: He is far ahead of his class in math.

definitions.definition: To do, carry through, conduct or perform some action.
To carry over, hand over or transfer something.
To conduct business.
To exchange or trade, as of ideas, money, goods, etc.
A jurisdiction that levies low tax rates on certain economic activities, especially to attract wealthy individuals and (foreign) businesses.
An unchanging state, as indicated in a graph of a variable over time.
Asystole; the absence of heart contractions or brain waves.
(of the heart) To stop beating.
(by extension) To die.
To kill.
To stay at the same level, without development; or, to fall.
Any species known only from trace fossils, such as footprints, coprolites or nests.
A short, sharp or high note or noise, as of a bird or insect.
(radar, sonar, radio telescopy etc.) A pulse of signal whose frequency sweeps through a band of frequencies for the duration of the pulse.
To make a short, sharp, cheerful note, as of small birds or crickets
To speak in a high-pitched staccato
(radar, sonar, radio telescopy etc.) To modify (a pulse of signal) so that it sweeps through a band of frequencies throughout its duration.
To cheer up; to make (someone) happier.
To approach slowly and quietly in order not to be discovered when getting closer.
To (try to) follow or contact someone constantly, often resulting in harassment.Wp
definitions.example: My ex-girlfriend is stalking me.

definitions.definition: To walk slowly and cautiously; to walk in a stealthy, noiseless manner.
To walk behind something, such as a screen, for the purpose of approaching game; to proceed under cover.
To walk haughtily.
The act of going stealthily.
Hunting for game by moving silently and stealthily or by waiting in ambush.
The crime of following or harassing another person, causing him or her to fear death or injury.
The removal of stalks from bunches of grapes prior to winemaking.
A narrow tube.
Any of the small blood vessels that connect arteries to veins.
Of or pertaining to hair.
Pertaining to a narrow tube.
Of, relating to, or caused by surface tension.
A player of the fielding side, whose task is to gather the ball after the batsman has hit it, to catch the batsman out, or to prevent him from scoring.
A defensive player in the field.
A dog trained in pursuit of game in the field.
One who fields anything.
A 16th century Spanish dance; the zarabanda
A stately Baroque dance in slow triple time
The music for either dance of the same name.
(Zimbabwe) A South African food categorized by strips of lean meat cured by salting and drying, similar to American jerky.
Any of a group of glycoproteins, produced by the immune system, that prevent viral replication in infected cells.
To seize and detain a person unlawfully; sometimes for ransom.
The crime of taking a person against their will, sometimes for ransom.
A brake in a vehicle that can be set to avoid the vehicle rolling down a hill or being pushed away.
A shrub belonging to the section Vaccinium sect. Oxycoccus of the genus Vaccinium.
The edible red berry of that shrub.
An intense red colour, like that of a cranberry
Of the intense red colour of a cranberry.
Doomed to a bad fate; hapless
A family consisting of parents and children, along with either grandparents, grandchildren, aunts or uncles, cousins, etc.
Any of several tropical fruit-eating bats of the family Pteropodidae; a megabat.
A drug, hormone or other substance derived from or related to opium.
Something that dulls the senses and induces a false and unrealistic sense of contentment.
To treat with an opiate drug.
Relating to, resembling, or containing opium.
(pharmaceutical effect) Soporific; inducing sleep or sedation.
Deadening; causing apathy or dullness.
Of, relating to, or occurring in the period after a surgical operation.
definitions.example: The postoperative procedure is as follows.

definitions.definition: A vertical partition dividing the hull into separate compartments; often made watertight to prevent excessive flooding if the ship's hull is breached.
A similar partition in an aircraft or spacecraft.
Mechanically, a partition or panel through which connectors pass, or a connector designed to pass through a partition.
A pressure-resistant sealed barrier to any fluid in a large structure.
A retaining wall along a waterfront.
Emerging; aspiring; beginning to attract attention or critical acclaim
definitions.example: The theater likes to feature up-and-coming singers and comedians.

definitions.definition: One who talks too much or too loudly, especially in a boastful or self-important manner.
definitions.example: I hear every word spoken by the loudmouth in the next office.

definitions.definition: To make or become supple.
To make compliant, submissive, or obedient.
Pliant, flexible, easy to bend
Lithe and agile when moving and bending
definitions.example: supple joints; supple fingers

definitions.definition: Compliant; yielding to the will of others
definitions.example: a supple horse

definitions.definition: A state of matter consisting of partially ionized gas and electrons
A clear component of blood or lymph containing fibrin
Blood plasma, free of suspended cells, used in transfusions
A variety of green quartz, used in ancient times for making engraved ornaments.
A mixture of starch and glycerin, used as a substitute for ointments.
A visual effect in which cycles of changing colours are warped in various ways to give the illusion of liquid organic movement.
Cold enough to cause discomfort.
Feeling uncomfortably cold.
definitions.example: I’m getting rather chilly over here – could you shut the window please?

definitions.definition: Distant and cool; unfriendly.
definitions.example: She gave me a chilly look when I made the suggestion.

definitions.definition: The pungent, spicy fresh or dried fruit of any of several cultivated varieties of capsicum peppers, used in cooking.
Powdered chili pepper, used as a spice or flavouring in cooking.
(Indian Chinese cuisine) a spicy stew of chicken or paneer, capsicum and onion, eaten as an appetizer.
A dish made with chili peppers and other ingredients, such as beans and beef.
(Cincinnati) Cincinnati chili.
Very wet; covered in or composed of slop.
definitions.example: The dog tracked sloppy mud through the kitchen!

definitions.definition: Messy; not neat, elegant, or careful.
definitions.example: The carpenter did a sloppy job of building the staircase.

definitions.definition: Imprecise or loose.
definitions.example: A sloppy measurement; a sloppy fit!

definitions.definition: A type of electronic percussion device.
To use one’s mouth, lips, tongue, voice, etc. as a percussive instrument to create beats and rhythms for music.
(law enforcement) An armed, undercover guard on a commercial-airline flight.
A military rank between that of air vice-marshal and air chief marshal, equivalent to an army lieutenant general.
(Midwest) A frankfurter, a hot dog.
Heated to the point that it glows with a visible red color.
definitions.example: The smith's apprentice was still wary of manipulating the red-hot metal.

definitions.definition: Very hot
definitions.example: that curry was red-hot

definitions.definition: Emotionally charged, especially with anger or enthusiasm.
definitions.example: He really delivered a red-hot speech today.

definitions.definition: Having a very strong sexual appeal.
definitions.example: Did you see that red-hot picture of Liv Tyler in today's paper?

definitions.definition: Very fresh, new, recent and up to date.
definitions.example: Tune in at ten to catch this red-hot story!

definitions.definition: Ambergris, the waxy product of the sperm whale.
A hard, generally yellow to brown translucent fossil resin, used for jewellery. One variety, blue amber, appears blue rather than yellow under direct sunlight.
A yellow-orange colour.
The intermediate light in a set of three traffic lights, which when illuminated indicates that drivers should stop short of the intersection if it is safe to do so.
The stop codon (nucleotide triplet) "UAG", or a mutant which has this stop codon at a premature place in its DNA sequence.
definitions.example: an amber codon, an amber mutation, an amber suppressor

definitions.definition: To perfume or flavour with ambergris.
definitions.example: ambered wine, an ambered room

definitions.definition: To preserve in amber.
definitions.example: an ambered fly

definitions.definition: To cause to take on the yellow colour of amber.
To take on the yellow colour of amber.
Of a brownish yellow colour, like that of most amber.
A simple circular, flat, unleavened bread made with sieved wholemeal flour and water, found in Indian cuisine.
One who sells cloths; a dealer in cloths.
The land where one plays golf, with tees, fairways, greens and flags in holes.
